intro: Ammocharis coranica, commonly known as the Cape belladonna lily, is a bulbous plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink. The plant produces a cluster of narrow, strap-like leaves that are often evergreen. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens for its elegant blooms and unique appearance.
